summary:
I am a Media and Information student at  University of Amsterdam with a strong passion for the digital world. My interests include social media, digital marketing, sales and software development. I am always excited to learn more about these fields and stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments.

As a highly communicative and organised individual, I take pride in my ability to connect with others and keep my work organised. I am also experienced in analysing complex issues and finding effective solutions.

My flexible mindset and dedication to continuous learning and improvement enable me to work well under pressure and meet deadlines while maintaining a high level of quality in my work.

I am eager to explore the diverse opportunities offered by the media and technology industry and to see where my passions and skills will take me in the future.

projects.title: Basarabia's Union Day
projects.description:
"Basarabia's Union Day" was an annual history contest dedicated to the preservation of Romanian cultural heritage and love for our land. As a former winner of the same contest, I was proud to be part of the organisation committee for this important event. In this role, I managed and supervised various aspects of the contest, ensuring that it ran smoothly and efficiently.

The contest was designed to test the historical knowledge of students and encourage them to explore the events that led to this crucial moment in Romania's history. Participants were asked a series of challenging questions about the historical happenings that led to this union, and were expected to provide insightful and well-researched answers.

I am honoured to have been part of an event that celebrates the rich history of Romania and inspires students to explore the past and learn from it.

projects.title: Leading towards a more human society and more tolerant world
projects.description:
"Leading Towards a More Human Society and More Tolerant World" is an exchange program that offers a unique opportunity for high school students to broaden their horizons and immerse themselves in a different culture. As a participant in this program, I had the incredible experience of studying at Grillska Gymnasiet in Uppsala, Sweden and living with a Swedish family.

The exchange program was not only an opportunity for personal growth and cultural exchange, but also an opportunity to represent my high school and foster a strong partnership between our institutions. I had the privilege of communicating with the management of the Swedish institution, sharing insights about my own culture and learning from theirs.

During my time in Sweden, I gained a greater appreciation for the diversity of cultures and the importance of building bridges across borders. Through discussions, workshops, and other activities, I gained a deeper understanding of the values of tolerance, mutual respect, and human rights

projects.title: The setting of a democratic culture and the European online citizenship
projects.description:
"The Setting of a Democratic Culture and the European Online Citizenship" is a collaborative project between our College and the High School of Tripolis in Greece. Our shared goal is to promote democratic values and cultivate a strong sense of European citizenship among young people.

Through a variety of engaging activities, we aim to provide high school students with a better understanding of democracy, the European Union, and the importance of active participation in the democratic process. In addition, we focus on developing digital skills and promoting responsible online behavior, empowering students to engage with the world through digital channels in a positive and constructive manner.

volunteer_experiences.description: "Let's Do It Romania" is a community-based volunteering project that is dedicated to cleaning up the natural environment in Bucharest. Through our collective efforts, we have worked to restore the beauty and health of several forests in Romania, promoting a cleaner and more sustainable future for all
